channel.title: Project DungeonFest Help. Client Compiling
channel.description:
Title Says It All Here Is My Compiler [code]@echo off javac -cp lib/clientlibs.jar;lib/com.jar; -d bin src/*.java @pause
[/code] And when I run it I get this [code]'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
How do I make It Recognized?

item.title: Project DungeonFest Help. Client Compiling
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Reverse Hate, post:5, topic:431217”]I do the first way and i get cannot find path specified, Also Perhaps maybe you can tell me how to fix the log4j error in server when I log in,log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger (org.apache.mina.filter.execut or.ExecutorFilter). log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly. It still lets me log in when I use a diff client (still working on making this one work)[/quote]
The message means that the log4j.properties file was not found. Printing logging output to the console (or rather System.out) is the fallback if the logging is not otherwise initialized.

It is a warning, though and not fatal.

Read full topic

item.title: Project DungeonFest Help. Client Compiling
item.dc:creator: @Reverse_Hate Reverse Hate
item.description:
@Reverse_Hate wrote:

I do the first way and i get cannot find path specified, Also Perhaps maybe you can tell me how to fix the log4j error in server when I log in,log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger (org.apache.mina.filter.execut or.ExecutorFilter). log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly. It still lets me log in when I use a diff client (still working on making this one work)

Read full topic

item.title: Project DungeonFest Help. Client Compiling
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

it’s probably better if you just do the first option, windows has a dumb way of doing it (System->Properties->Advanced->Environment Variables->Highlight CLASSPATH->Edit…->Append the java compiler location to the end with a ‘;’ delineating itself from the previous).

Read full topic

item.title: Project DungeonFest Help. Client Compiling
item.dc:creator: @Reverse_Hate Reverse Hate
item.description:
@Reverse_Hate wrote:

How do I add it to my environmental variables? like the path and name.

Read full topic

item.title: Project DungeonFest Help. Client Compiling
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

the java compiler is not currently in your executable path. you can either explicitly give the entire path to the java compiler (“C:\Program Files\Java\bin\javac.exe”) or add that to your environment path.

Read full topic

item.title: Project DungeonFest Help. Client Compiling
item.dc:creator: @Reverse_Hate Reverse Hate
item.description:
@Reverse_Hate wrote:

Title Says It All Here Is My Compiler [code]@echo off
javac -cp lib/clientlibs.jar;lib/com.jar; -d bin src/*.java
@pause

[/code]
And when I run it I get this 'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .

How do I make It Recognized?

Read full topic
